title: Toy Story (1995)
name: Toy Story
writer: John Lasseter, Pete Docter, Andrew Stanton
actors: Tom Hanks, Tim Allen, Don Rickles
plot: A cowboy doll is profoundly jealous when a new spaceman action figure supplants him as the top toy in a boy's bedroom. When circumstances separate them from their owner, the duo have to put aside their differences to return to him.
awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. 29 wins & 24 nominations total

title: Jumanji (1995)
name: Jumanji
writer: Jonathan Hensleigh, Greg Taylor, Jim Strain
actors: Robin Williams, Kirsten Dunst, Bonnie Hunt
plot: When two kids find and play a magical board game, they release a man trapped in it for decades - and a host of dangers that can only be stopped by finishing the game.

title: Grumpier Old Men (1995)
name: Grumpier Old Men
actors: Walter Matthau, Jack Lemmon, Ann-Margret
plot: John and Max resolve to save their beloved bait shop from turning into an Italian restaurant, just as its new female owner catches Max's attention.

title: Waiting to Exhale (1995)
name: Waiting to Exhale
actors: Whitney Houston, Angela Bassett, Loretta Devine
plot: Based on Terry McMillan's novel, this film follows four very different African-American women and their relationships with men.

title: Father of the Bride Part II (1995)
name: Father of the Bride Part II
writer: Albert Hackett, Frances Goodrich, Nancy Meyers
actors: Steve Martin, Diane Keaton, Martin Short
plot: George Banks must deal not only with his daughter's pregnancy, but also with his wife's.

title: Heat (1995)
name: Heat
actors: Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, Val Kilmer
plot: A group of high-end professional thieves start to feel the heat from the LAPD when they unknowingly leave a verbal clue at their latest heist.

title: Sabrina (1995)
name: Sabrina
writer: Billy Wilder, Samuel A. Taylor, Ernest Lehman
actors: Humphrey Bogart, Audrey Hepburn, William Holden
plot: After her return from school in Paris, a playboy finally takes notice of his family's chauffeur's daughter, who's long had a crush on him, but he questions his more serious brother's motives when he warns against getting involved ...

title: Tom and Huck (1995)
name: Tom and Huck
writer: Mark Twain, Stephen Sommers, David Loughery
actors: Jonathan Taylor Thomas, Brad Renfro, Charles Rocket
plot: Two best friends witness a murder and embark on a series of adventures in order to prove the innocence of the man wrongly accused of the crime.

title: Sudden Death (1995)
name: Sudden Death
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Powers Boothe, Raymond J. Barry
plot: A former fireman takes on a group of terrorists holding the Vice President and others hostage during the seventh game of the NHL Stanley Cup finals.

title: GoldenEye (1995)
name: GoldenEye
writer: Ian Fleming, Michael France, Jeffrey Caine
actors: Pierce Brosnan, Sean Bean, Izabella Scorupco
plot: When a powerful secret defense system is stolen, James Bond is assigned to stop a Russian crime syndicate from using it.
awards: Nominated for 2 BAFTA 2 wins & 8 nominations total

title: American President, The (1995)
name: The American President
actors: Michael Douglas, Annette Bening, Martin Sheen
plot: A widowed U.S. President running for reelection and an environmental lobbyist fall in love. It's all above-board, but "politics is perception," and sparks fly anyway.
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. 1 win & 11 nominations total

title: Dracula: Dead and Loving It (1995)
name: Dracula: Dead and Loving It
writer: Mel Brooks, Rudy De Luca, Steve Haberman
actors: Leslie Nielsen, Mel Brooks, Peter MacNicol
plot: Mel Brooks' parody of the classic vampire story and its famous film adaptations.

title: Balto (1995)
name: Balto
writer: Cliff Ruby, Elana Lesser, David Steven Cohen
actors: Kevin Bacon, Bob Hoskins, Bridget Fonda
plot: An outcast Husky risks his life with other sled dogs to prevent a deadly epidemic from ravaging Nome, Alaska.

title: Nixon (1995)
name: Nixon
writer: Stephen J. Rivele, Christopher Wilkinson, Oliver Stone
actors: Anthony Hopkins, Joan Allen, Powers Boothe
plot: A biographical story of former U.S. President Richard Nixon, from his days as a young boy, to his eventual Presidency, which ended in shame.
awards: Nominated for 4 Oscars. 11 wins & 18 nominations total

title: Cutthroat Island (1995)
name: Cutthroat Island
writer: Michael Frost Beckner, James Gorman, Bruce A. Evans
actors: Geena Davis, Matthew Modine, Frank Langella
plot: A female pirate and her companion race against their rivals to find a hidden island that contains a fabulous treasure.

title: Casino (1995)
name: Casino
actors: Robert De Niro, Sharon Stone, Joe Pesci
plot: In Las Vegas, two best friends--a casino executive and a Mafia enforcer--compete for a gambling empire and a fast-living, fast-loving socialite.
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. 4 wins & 11 nominations total

title: Sense and Sensibility (1995)
name: Sense and Sensibility
actors: Emma Thompson, Kate Winslet, James Fleet
plot: Rich Mr. Dashwood dies, leaving his second wife and her three daughters poor by the rules of inheritance. The older two daughters are the title opposites.

title: Four Rooms (1995)
name: Four Rooms
director: Allison Anders, Alexandre Rockwell, Robert Rodriguez
writer: Allison Anders, Alexandre Rockwell, Robert Rodriguez
actors: Tim Roth, Antonio Banderas, Sammi Davis
plot: Four interlocking tales that take place in a fading hotel on New Year's Eve.

title: Ace Ventura: When Nature Calls (1995)
name: Ace Ventura: When Nature Calls
actors: Jim Carrey, Ian McNeice, Simon Callow
plot: Ace Ventura, Pet Detective, returns from a spiritual quest to investigate the disappearance of a rare white bat, the sacred animal of a tribe in Africa.

title: Money Train (1995)
name: Money Train
actors: Wesley Snipes, Woody Harrelson, Jennifer Lopez
plot: A vengeful New York City transit cop decides to steal a trainload of subway fares. His foster brother, a fellow cop, tries to protect him.

title: Get Shorty (1995)
name: Get Shorty
actors: Gene Hackman, Rene Russo, Danny DeVito
plot: A mobster travels from Florida to Hollywood to collect a debt and discovers that the movie business is just as sleazy as the Miami underworld.

title: Copycat (1995)
name: Copycat
actors: Sigourney Weaver, Holly Hunter, Dermot Mulroney
plot: A criminal psychologist who turned agoraphobic after a murder attempt agrees to help two San Francisco detectives hunt for a copycat serial killer who intends on making her his next victim.

title: Assassins (1995)
name: Assassins
writer: Lilly Wachowski, Lana Wachowski, Brian Helgeland
actors: Sylvester Stallone, Antonio Banderas, Julianne Moore
plot: Professional hit-man Robert Rath wants to fulfill a few more contracts before retiring but unscrupulous ambitious newcomer hit-man Miguel Bain keeps killing Rath's targets.

title: Powder (1995)
name: Powder
actors: Mary Steenburgen, Sean Patrick Flanery, Lance Henriksen
plot: An off-the-charts genius who is home schooled and shunned after his last relative dies shows the unconscious residents of his town about connection awareness and the generosity of the spirit.

title: Leaving Las Vegas (1995)
name: Leaving Las Vegas
actors: Nicolas Cage, Elisabeth Shue, Julian Sands
plot: Ben Sanderson, a Hollywood screenwriter who lost everything because of his alcoholism, arrives in Las Vegas to drink himself to death. There, he meets and forms an uneasy friendship and non-interference pact with prostitute Sera.

title: Othello (1995)
name: Othello
actors: Laurence Fishburne, Kenneth Branagh, Irène Jacob
plot: The Moorish General Othello is manipulated into thinking that his new wife Desdemona has been carrying on an affair with his Lieutenant Michael Cassio, when in reality, it is all part of the scheme of a bitter Ensign named Iago.

title: Now and Then (1995)
name: Now and Then
actors: Christina Ricci, Demi Moore, Rosie O'Donnell
plot: Four childhood friends gather together to prepare for the birth of Chrissey's baby. They wonder how the girls they were at twelve years could possibly have become the women they are now.

title: Persuasion (1995)
name: Persuasion
writer: Ron Bass, Alice Victoria Winslow, Jane Austen
actors: Richard E. Grant, Henry Golding, Ben Bailey Smith
plot: Eight years after Anne Elliot was persuaded not to marry a dashing man of humble origins, they meet again. Will she seize her second chance at true love?

title: City of Lost Children, The (Cité des enfants perdus, La) (1995)
name: The City of Lost Children
writer: Gilles Adrien, Jean-Pierre Jeunet, Marc Caro
actors: Ron Perlman, Daniel Emilfork, Judith Vittet
plot: A scientist in a surrealist society kidnaps children to steal their dreams, hoping that they slow his aging process.

title: Shanghai Triad (Yao a yao yao dao waipo qiao) (1995)
name: Shanghai Triad
writer: Feiyu Bi, Bin Wang, Li Xiao
actors: Gong Li, Baotian Li, Xiaoxiao Wang
plot: A provincial boy related to a Shanghai crime family is recruited by his uncle into cosmopolitan Shanghai in the 1930s to be a servant to a ganglord's mistress.
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. 5 wins & 4 nominations total

title: Dangerous Minds (1995)
name: Dangerous Minds
actors: Michelle Pfeiffer, George Dzundza, Courtney B. Vance
plot: LouAnne, a retired US marine, becomes a teacher in a Californian high school. But her mostly Latino and black students from an impoverished and racially segregated locality do not easily embrace her.

title: Twelve Monkeys (a.k.a. 12 Monkeys) (1995)
name: Twelve Monkeys
actors: Keith Fulton, Terry Gilliam, Charles Roven, Lloyd Phillips
plot: A documentary following Terry Gilliam through the creation of "12 Monkeys" (1995)

title: Babe (1995)
name: Babe
writer: Dick King-Smith, George Miller, Chris Noonan
actors: James Cromwell, Magda Szubanski, Christine Cavanaugh
plot: Gentle farmer Arthur Hoggett wins a piglet Babe at a county fair. Narrowly escaping his fate as Christmas dinner, Babe bonds with motherly border collie Fly and discovers that he too can herd sheep. But will the other animals acce...

title: Dead Man Walking (1995)
name: Dead Man Walking
actors: Susan Sarandon, Sean Penn, Robert Prosky
plot: A nun, while comforting a convicted killer on death row, empathizes with both the killer and his victim's families.

title: It Takes Two (1995)
name: It Takes Two
actors: Kirstie Alley, Steve Guttenberg, Mary-Kate Olsen
plot: Alyssa and Amanda are two little girls who are identical, but complete strangers, that accidentally meet one day.

title: Clueless (1995)
name: Clueless
actors: Alicia Silverstone, Stacey Dash, Brittany Murphy
plot: Shallow, rich and socially successful Cher is at the top of her Beverly Hills high school's pecking scale. Seeing herself as a matchmaker, Cher first coaxes two teachers into dating each other.

title: Cry, the Beloved Country (1995)
name: Cry, the Beloved Country
actors: Richard Harris, James Earl Jones, Vusi Kunene
plot: A South African preacher goes to search for his wayward son, who has committed a crime in the big city.

title: Richard III (1995)
name: Richard III
writer: Ian McKellen, Richard Loncraine, Richard Eyre
actors: Ian McKellen, Annette Bening, Christopher Bowen
plot: The classic Shakespearean play about the murderously scheming 15th-century king is reimagined in an alternative setting of 1930s England as clouds of fascism gather.
awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. 7 wins & 12 nominations total

title: Dead Presidents (1995)
name: Dead Presidents
writer: Allen Hughes, Albert Hughes, Michael Henry Brown
actors: Larenz Tate, Keith David, Chris Tucker
plot: A Vietnam vet adjusts to life after the war while trying to support his family, but the chance of a better life may involve crime and bloodshed.

title: Restoration (1995)
name: Restoration
actors: Robert Downey Jr., Sam Neill, David Thewlis
plot: The exiled royal doctor to King Charles II devotes himself to helping Londoners suffering from the plague, and in the process falls in love with an equally poor woman.

title: Mortal Kombat (1995)
name: Mortal Kombat
writer: Greg Russo, Dave Callaham, Oren Uziel
actors: Lewis Tan, Jessica McNamee, Josh Lawson
plot: MMA fighter Cole Young seeks out Earth's greatest champions in order to stand against the enemies of Outworld in a high stakes battle for the universe.

title: To Die For (1995)
name: To Die For
actors: Nicole Kidman, Matt Dillon, Joaquin Phoenix
plot: A beautiful but naïve aspiring television personality films a documentary on teenagers with a darker ulterior motive.
awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Award7 wins & 17 nominations total

title: How to Make an American Quilt (1995)
name: How to Make an American Quilt
actors: Winona Ryder, Ellen Burstyn, Anne Bancroft
plot: Bride-to-be Finn Dodd hears tales of romance and sorrow from her elders as they construct a quilt.

title: Seven (a.k.a. Se7en) (1995)
name: Seven
writer: Akira Kurosawa, Shinobu Hashimoto, Hideo Oguni
actors: Toshirô Mifune, Takashi Shimura, Keiko Tsushima
plot: Farmers from a village exploited by bandits hire a veteran samurai for protection, and he gathers six other samurai to join him.

title: Pocahontas (1995)
name: Pocahontas
writer: Carl Binder, Susannah Grant, Philip LaZebnik
actors: Mel Gibson, Linda Hunt, Christian Bale
plot: An English soldier and the daughter of an Algonquin chief share a romance when English colonists invade seventeenth century Virginia.
